title: Ping increased issue
body: Hey guys, I'm currently having an increased ping for some reason. I'm actually playing on OCE server from SEA region and my usual ping is supposed to be around 125ms but right now it's around 230 ms to 300. I was wondering what's causing this. Is it really because of my ISP or is it the server? I would appreciate any help.

replies.body:
Hey there,

I'm confused, are you playing on a SEA server? or OCE?

The account you're posting on is an OCE account, however you mention playing on SEA (Garena).
Hey, I meant that I live in Singapore but I'm playing on OCE server.

Hey there,

If you're still experiencing issues could you please do the following for me;

* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and the url to your ICSI netalyzr results.
Hey, is there a mac version of WinMTR by any chance? If there aren't any then are there any alternatives for that?

To run an MTR on mac, please perform the following steps.

* Go [here](http://rudix.org/packages/mtr.html) and download the package appropriate for your version of OSX
* Install it
* [Open terminal](http://i.imgur.com/10nFokA.png)
* Run the following command and hit enter (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)

>mtr 103.240.227.5

* After a reasonable amount of time has elapsed (5-15 minutes) please screenshot your results (follow steps below)
 * Hit cmd+shft+4, then hit space
 *  click on the Terminal window (your mouse cursor should turn into a camera icon and the window should be highlighted on mouse over)
* Upload the screenshot anywhere you would like and link here ([Imgur](http://imgur.com/), etc)

Here's the results. Oh, I forgot to mention that my ping increase at a certain time. Right now it's around 140 which is pretty good but it spikes to 170 a little. Sometimes my ping went up to 230 ms. 

http://imgur.com/a/1m5Ul

Hey there,

Apologies for the delayed response.

* Are you still experiencing this issue?
* Could you also provide me the results from netalyzr as requested above.

From your MTR results I can definitely see some noticeable packet loss that is seemingly originating from your ISP's end of things, have you tried contacting them about this?

Yes, I think I'm still experiencing this issue though it's not as bad as it was before. It has improved a little. My ping now stays at 170 instead of 230.

Here it is: http://n1.netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/summary/id=369839a0-32395-116d0ff8-08e8-4512-ba15

Not yet. My internet hasn't been that much of an issue to me but I might contact them soon.

Hey there,

From your netalyzr results I notice a few things to be fixed, while not all of these may resolve your connectivity issues, some may help. I still recommend speaking to your ISP.

* [Switch to a public DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#mq4)
* You appear to have a very high rate of packet buffering on your connection, I suggest taking a look at [this page](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#mq6)  for more info on what causes packet buffering and things you can do to attempt to resolve the issue

I'm having the same issue but in JP server. I've done everything the connection troubleshoot says but it still doesn't change it. Called out my ISP and some technicians but I still manage to have this issue. Normal ping is usually 96-102, now it's 196-208
